title: Rapid Prototyping-Based Microlearning for Enhancing Online Information Utilization Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital device usage skills and internet search experience
context.additional_context: Information literacy education for adult learners in graduate schools, requiring design optimized for short smartphone-based learning modules. Reference cases of rapid transition to online during emergencies like COVID-19

learning_goals: Learners identify credible online information sources with 80% accuracy.
Learners improve information search efficiency by 70% in smartphone environments by applying filtering techniques.
Learners apply a 5-step logical writing structure using online resources in project-based assessments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
